title: CDS (Catalogue Delivery Service/Licensing Server)
text: What is CDS? CDS is a virtual server in a hosted environment from OVH (https://www.ovhcloud.com/en-gb/) consisting of one server running Windows, IIS, SQL and Filezilla Server NIC Handle - jd69276-ovh Contact number 0333 370 0425* Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm Can I access it? Yes and No, due to the nature of what it does, only certain users have access via TeamViewer or via the Vsphere backed if access is required to the server please speak with the following people Thomas Toulouse What does it do? RMS Catalogues - Is used by RMS customers (Shoe Retailers) to select and schedule for download the supplier catalogues (which the support team would have covered into the correct format) the SIM (Supplier Integration) Starite - Hold the packing note for sending between retailers and startite RMSify - Host RMSify webpages and application Licensing - Is used to check license status for RMS apps i.e. RMSify, RTL Report, Pos utilities etc. Error logging Emails - Controls the emails for error reports for RMS custom apps LS One Licensing - Controls licenses for the addin/plugins for LS VPoS Winftp - Host the FTP server which the stores/HQ send and receive files. Is it backed up? YES! - Its done by the K3 N-Central solution. IT manage the backup (Nootdorp account) - server called K3-R or K£-CDS ? ?
description:
What is CDS?

 

CDS is a virtual server in a hosted environment from OVH (https://www.ovhcloud.com/en-gb/) consisting of one server running Windows, IIS, SQL and Filezilla Server

 

 

 

NIC Handle - jd69276-ovh

 

Contact number 

 

0333 370 0425* Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm 

 


Can I access it?

Yes and No, due to the nature of what it does, only certain users have access via TeamViewer or via the Vsphere backed if access is required to the server please speak with the following people

 

Thomas Toulouse

 

What does it do?


RMS

Catalogues - Is used by RMS customers (Shoe Retailers) to select and schedule for download the supplier catalogues (which the support team would have covered into the correct format) the SIM (Supplier Integration)

Starite - Hold the packing note for sending between retailers and startite

RMSify - Host RMSify webpages and application

Licensing - Is used to check license status for RMS apps i.e. RMSify, RTL Report, Pos utilities etc.

Error logging Emails - Controls the emails for error reports for RMS custom apps

 

LS One

Licensing - Controls licenses for the addin/plugins for LS

 

VPoS

Winftp - Host the FTP server which the stores/HQ send and receive files.

 

Is it backed up?

 

 YES! - Its done by the K3 N-Central solution. IT manage the backup (Nootdorp account) - server called K3-R or K£-CDS ? ?

title: CDS SSL Certificate Update
text: By Thomas T The websites hosted on CDS use SSL certificates provided by GoDaddy that are valid for 12 months from the issue date. When the certificate expires it needs to be updated by completing the following. Retrieving Updated Certificate Log into GoDaddy and navigate to the ‘My Products’ section. Expand the SSL certificates and click ‘Manage’ on cds.k3retail.com. Download ZIP file and transfer to CDS in “E:\Temp\Cert”. Add Certificate Snap-in to the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) Click on the Start Menu, then click Run. In the prompt, type mmc and click OK. Click File, then click Add/Remove Snap-in. On the new window, click the Add button. On the new window, select Certificates and click Add. Select Computer account for the snap-in and click Next. Click Local computer and click Finish. Click Close on the Add Standalone Snap-in window. Click OK on the Add/Remove Snap-in window. Import the Intermediate SSL Certificate In the MCC Console, click ▸ to expand Certificates (Local Computer). Right click on the Intermediate Certification Authorities folder, hover over All Tasks and click Import. On the new window, click Next. Click Browse, find the previously uploaded intermediate certificate file and click Open. Click Next, verify that the certificate information is proper and click Finish. Close the ‘the import was successful’ notification. Install the SSL Certificate Open IIS Manager Under the Connections panel on the left, click on localhost. In the main panel under the IIS section, double click on Server Certificates. Under the Actions panel on the right, click Complete Certificate Request. On the new window, click ... to browse, find the previously uploaded primary certificate file and click Open (this will be the .pem file in the ZIP folder). Add the expiry year suffix to the certificate name. In the certificate store option, select Personal and click OK. Bind the SSL Certificate Under the Connections panel on the left, click ▸ to expand the Sites folder. Click ‘Default Web Site’. Under the Actions panel on the right, find the Edit Site section and click Bindings. Click on the https binding and click Edit on the right. Select the new SSL certificate from the drop-down. Click OK to confirm, then Close for the Site Bindings window. Repeat this process for other the K3SoftwareControl site. Restart IIS Under the Actions panel on the right, find the Manage Website section and click Restart. Check the New Certificate Navigate to an SSL checking website such as https://www.sslshopper.com/ssl-checker.html Enter the CDS URL to test. For example, ‘cds.k3retail.com:444’ (it's important to note the port number you’re checking. If no port number is given this will only check port 443 which is the K3SoftwareControl site). Ensure the certificate has been updated:
description:
By Thomas  T

The websites hosted on CDS use SSL certificates provided by GoDaddy that are valid for 12 months from the issue date. When the certificate expires it needs to be updated by completing the following.

 Retrieving Updated Certificate

    1. Log into GoDaddy and navigate to the ‘My Products’ section. 
    2. Expand the SSL certificates and click ‘Manage’ on cds.k3retail.com. 
    3. Download ZIP file and transfer to CDS in “E:\Temp\Cert”.

 

Add Certificate Snap-in to the Microsoft Management Console (MMC)

    1. Click on the Start Menu, then click Run.
    2. In the prompt, type mmc and click OK.
    3. Click File, then click Add/Remove Snap-in.
    4. On the new window, click the Add button.
    5. On the new window, select Certificates and click Add.
    6. Select Computer account for the snap-in and click Next.
    7. Click Local computer and click Finish.
    8. Click Close on the Add Standalone Snap-in window.
    9. Click OK on the Add/Remove Snap-in window.

 

Import the Intermediate SSL Certificate

    1. In the MCC Console, click ▸ to expand Certificates (Local Computer).
    2. Right click on the Intermediate Certification Authorities folder, hover over All Tasks and click Import.
    3. On the new window, click Next.
    4. Click Browse, find the previously uploaded intermediate certificate file and click Open.
    5. Click Next, verify that the certificate information is proper and click Finish.
    6. Close the ‘the import was successful’ notification.

 

Install the SSL Certificate

    1. Open IIS Manager
    2. Under the Connections panel on the left, click on localhost.
    3. In the main panel under the IIS section, double click on Server Certificates.
    4. Under the Actions panel on the right, click Complete Certificate Request.
    5. On the new window, click ... to browse, find the previously uploaded primary certificate file and click Open (this will be the .pem file in the ZIP folder).
    6. Add the expiry year suffix to the certificate name.
    7. In the certificate store option, select Personal and click OK.

 

Bind the SSL Certificate

    1. Under the Connections panel on the left, click ▸ to expand the Sites folder.
    2. Click ‘Default Web Site’.
    3. Under the Actions panel on the right, find the Edit Site section and click Bindings.
    4. Click on the https binding and click Edit on the right.
    5. Select the new SSL certificate from the drop-down.
    6. Click OK to confirm, then Close for the Site Bindings window.
    7. Repeat this process for other the K3SoftwareControl site. 

 

Restart IIS

    1. Under the Actions panel on the right, find the Manage Website section and click Restart.

 

Check the New Certificate

    1. Navigate to an SSL checking website such as https://www.sslshopper.com/ssl-checker.html 
    2. Enter the CDS URL to test. For example, ‘cds.k3retail.com:444’ (it's important to note the port number you’re checking. If no port number is given this will only check port 443 which is the K3SoftwareControl site).
    3. Ensure the certificate has been updated:

title: K3 SIM
text: K3 SIM is a supplier integration module that allows shoe retailers to download catalogue files from our CDS hosted site. The shoe suppliers provide us with a catalogue file for each new season SS / AW that provides all the item information for the RMS customers to import the new styles. Due to the item information being from a wide range of suppliers the item information differs slightly. We need to use our template to correctly import the catalogues onto our CDS system making it easy for the customer to download the new styles. The files are uploaded to CDS using the 'ToConvert' file. ftp://cds.k3retail.com/ If the upload has any issues with the file due to incorrect format etc then the file will be rejected and an email is sent to the support inbox stating more details. You can also view the error log from the ftp 'Error' folder.
description:
K3 SIM is a supplier integration module that allows shoe retailers to download catalogue files from our CDS hosted site. The shoe suppliers provide us with a catalogue file for each new season SS / AW that provides all the item information for the RMS customers to import the new styles.


Due to the item information being from a wide range of suppliers the item information differs slightly. We need to use our template to correctly import the catalogues onto our CDS system making it easy for the customer to download the new styles.


The files are uploaded to CDS using the 'ToConvert' file.

ftp://cds.k3retail.com/


If the upload has any issues with the file due to incorrect format etc then the file will be rejected and an email is sent to the support inbox stating more details. You can also view the error log from the ftp 'Error' folder.

title: Converting Supplier Catalogues for CDS
text: We provide a service to our shoe retailers that allows them to download new styles from the CDS website for easy item creation in their RMS system. We receive catalogues from suppliers that we then convert into a CDS friendly format and upload to the CDS FTP for conversion. Some catalogues are more straight forward than others but some can be quite complicated. The below Webinar runs through the process of converting and uploading a supplier catalogue to CDS for Shoe Retailers to download. Support Test Account for Downloading from the CDS Server: Account No: 999997 Username: support Password: supp0rt CDS FTP Details: Server: cds.k3retail.com Username: catalogues Password: catal0gues Converted catalogues should be placed in the To Convert folder. *PLEASE DO NOT UPLOAD CATALOGUES UNLESS YOU ARE HAPPY THEY ARE CORRECT,THIS IS A LIVE SERVER SO INCORRECT ITEMS WILL HAVE AN AFFECT TO CUSTOMERS
description:
We provide a service to our shoe retailers that allows them to download new styles from the CDS website for easy item creation in their RMS system. We receive catalogues from suppliers that we then convert into a CDS friendly format and upload to the CDS FTP for conversion. Some catalogues are more straight forward than others but some can be quite complicated.


The below Webinar runs through the process of converting and uploading a supplier catalogue to CDS for Shoe Retailers to download.



Support Test Account for Downloading from the CDS Server: 

Account No: 999997 

Username: support 

Password: supp0rt 

CDS FTP Details: 

Server: cds.k3retail.com 

Username: catalogues 

Password: catal0gues 

Converted catalogues should be placed in the To Convert folder. 

*PLEASE DO NOT UPLOAD CATALOGUES UNLESS YOU ARE HAPPY THEY ARE CORRECT,THIS IS A LIVE SERVER SO INCORRECT ITEMS WILL HAVE AN AFFECT TO CUSTOMERS
